name: Nitin Sijwali

project.role: IC frontend — User Flows, Rapid Prototyping, POCs
project.description: Items that are same but have different options(eg: colors, size) are grouped for a single presentation and customer selects purchase option.
project.overview: Created a RBAC Micro Frontend web app which led Vendors, Brand Advocates and operation users create Product Variation Groups via single create or Bulk upload and maintain them.They could add/maintain the category attributes and their display settings. The upload images functionality reduced the chances of creating a bad group.Till now over millions of items has been used to create group via UI.
responsibilities: Created responsive UI designs with their internal framework and libraries built on top of reactjs.
Built Reusable React components with modular CSS, and state management on the client with Redux
Measured and resolved performance bottlenecks with Chrome DevTools and Lighthouse
Collaborated with product, design, and UX teams to create amazing and intuitive experiences.
Proving use case of functionalities using Fullstory analytics tool.

He is great at mentoring juniors, guiding and challenging them to deliver their best. Nitin has a great ability to translate complex designs into seamless user experiences. He asks the right questions early, avoiding complexities which might creep in at later stages of development. In case of issues with the User Experience he always comes forward with solutions to choose from, which imo, is one of the signs of a good engineer. Wish him all the best and I know he will do great at whatever he puts his mind to!
